snippet: David Samson, who is an ally of Gov. Chris Christie, voted to award contracts on bridge projects worth $2.8 billion to companies connected to Mr. Samson’s law firm.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in New Jersey issue subpoena to Port Authority of New York and New Jersey seeking records relating to its chairman, David Samson; also seek records on contracts on two bridge projects worth $2.8 billion that Samson voted to award to construction companies with some ties to his law firm; focus is conflicts of interest and is part of inquiry into scandal over lane closings at the George Washington Bridge.
lead_paragraph: David Samson, who is an ally of Gov. Chris Christie, voted to award contracts on bridge projects worth $2.8 billion to companies connected to Mr. Samson’s law firm.

headline.main: Inquiry Seeks Port Authority Records That Involve Christie Ally
headline.print_headline: Inquiry Seeks Port Records That Involve Christie Ally

keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
keywords.name: organizations
